Lists of chromosome for crops

Source: R/bioinformatics.R
crop_chromosome.Rd

Lists of chromosome for crops

crop_chromosome(crops, type = c("list", "data.frame"))

Arguments

crops

a vector of crops (i.e. wheat, barley, canola)

type

return as list or data.frame

Value

a list or data.frame for predefined chromosome

Examples

crop_chromosome(c("wheat", "barley", "canola"), type = "data.frame")
#>      crop chromosome
#> 1   wheat         1A
#> 2   wheat         2A
#> 3   wheat         3A
#> 4   wheat         4A
#> 5   wheat         5A
#> 6   wheat         6A
#> 7   wheat         7A
#> 8   wheat         1B
#> 9   wheat         2B
#> 10  wheat         3B
#> 11  wheat         4B
#> 12  wheat         5B
#> 13  wheat         6B
#> 14  wheat         7B
#> 15  wheat         1D
#> 16  wheat         2D
#> 17  wheat         3D
#> 18  wheat         4D
#> 19  wheat         5D
#> 20  wheat         6D
#> 21  wheat         7D
#> 22 barley         1H
#> 23 barley         2H
#> 24 barley         3H
#> 25 barley         4H
#> 26 barley         5H
#> 27 barley         6H
#> 28 barley         7H
#> 29 canola     chrA01
#> 30 canola     chrA02
#> 31 canola     chrA03
#> 32 canola     chrA04
#> 33 canola     chrA05
#> 34 canola     chrA06
#> 35 canola     chrA07
#> 36 canola     chrA08
#> 37 canola     chrA09
#> 38 canola     chrA10
#> 39 canola     chrC01
#> 40 canola     chrC02
#> 41 canola     chrC03
#> 42 canola     chrC04
#> 43 canola     chrC05
#> 44 canola     chrC06
#> 45 canola     chrC07
#> 46 canola     chrC08
#> 47 canola     chrC09
crop_chromosome(c("wheat", "barley", "canola"))
#> $wheat
#>  [1] "1A" "2A" "3A" "4A" "5A" "6A" "7A" "1B" "2B" "3B" "4B" "5B" "6B" "7B" "1D"
#> [16] "2D" "3D" "4D" "5D" "6D" "7D"
#> 
#> $barley
#> [1] "1H" "2H" "3H" "4H" "5H" "6H" "7H"
#> 
#> $canola
#>  [1] "chrA01" "chrA02" "chrA03" "chrA04" "chrA05" "chrA06" "chrA07" "chrA08"
#>  [9] "chrA09" "chrA10" "chrC01" "chrC02" "chrC03" "chrC04" "chrC05" "chrC06"
#> [17] "chrC07" "chrC08" "chrC09"
#>
